Job Posting:173422 - Position: W26 Cyber Security, Winter 2026 - Toronto (Co- op/Internship) - 4 Months 173422B Co-op Work Term Posted: 2026 - Winter App Deadline Application Method: Posting Goes Live: Job Posting Status: 09/24/2025 09:00 AM Through Employer Website 09/16/2025 04:17 PM Approved ORGANIZATION INFORMATION Organization Address Line 1 City Postal Code / Zip Code Province / State Country QuadReal Property Group Park Place 666 Burrard Street, Suite 800 Vancouver V6C 2X8 BC Canada JOB POSTING INFORMATION Placement Term <b> Job Title <b> Position Type Job Location Country Duration Work Mode 2026 - Winter W26 Cyber Security, Winter 2026 - Toronto (Co-op/Internship) - 4 Months 173422B Co-op Position Toronto, ON Canada 4 months To be confirmed Salary Currency CAD Salary Job Description Salary Not Available, 0 Major List QuadReal recommends that students apply to a maximum of three positions. About QuadReal Property Group QuadReal Property Group is a global real estate investment, operating and development company headquartered in Vancouver, British Columbia. Its assets under management are $94 billion. From its foundation in Canada as a full-service real estate operating company, QuadReal has expanded its capabilities to invest in equity and debt in both the public and private markets. QuadReal invests directly, via programmatic partnerships and through operating platforms in which it holds an ownership interest. QuadReal seeks to deliver strong investment returns while creating sustainable environments that bring value to the people and communities it serves. Now and for generations to come. QuadReal: Excellence lives here. www.quadreal.com We are committed to providing our Co-ops/Interns with a student experience that provides a supportive and engaging learning environment while developing skills and business acumen. Students will have the opportunity to participate in a variety of experiences including our Corporate Speaker Series, Fireside Chats, Volunteer opportunities and Networking events. Eligibility Note: To qualify for a student (Co-op/Internship) opportunity, students must be enrolled in their academic studies at a post-secondary institution (university/college) and must be returning to school after completion of their work term with QuadReal. If you are a student registered in an official co-op program at your post-secondary institution and completion of a final work term is a mandatory component for you to graduate, you are eligible to apply with the understanding that you will leave QuadReal at the end of your work term or have the possibility to be considered for full- time opportunities. Based in Toronto, the Co-op/Intern, Cybersecurity, will report to the Senior Manager, Cyber Security. The role of the Cyber Security Intern at QuadReal is to assist in the day-to-day operations as well as participate in the discovery and documentation process of security issues in our established, yet evolving, IT environment. The Intern will get to review security events of interest and respond to them with guidance from the Cyber Security team. As well as assisting the team in managing and optimizing existing IT security systems, the implementation of new security solutions, auditing and security metric reporting, and conducting technical vulnerability assessments. The Cyber Security Intern will come with an understanding of major operating systems and networking concepts coupled with a strong desire for continuous learning. There will also be opportunities for this role to provide innovative solutions to problems and improve the processes and tools used currently within the team. What We Offer: • An organization and leaders that support your development through meaningful work experience • A Student Mentorship Program designed to provide 1:1 support throughout your experience • Opportunities to build your industry knowledge through Corporate Speaker Series & Fireside Chats • Giving back to community with your peers and team members through volunteering events • Opportunities to build long lasting industry and professional relationships What You Will Experience: Cyber Security Operations • Monitor in-place IT security solutions to make sure its operations are efficient and appropriate • Respond to Cyber Security incidents and help update incident handling procedures. • Look at logs and reports of IT devices (i.e., workstations, servers, network devices) and identify suspicious or anomalous activity • Collaborate with other IT teams to solve security related issues. Make recommendations and/or implement improvements to structures or processes related to IT security operations • Cyber Security Vulnerability Management • Investigate and identify potential security vulnerabilities within the QuadReal IT environment • Document identified security vulnerabilities, the associated risks and the steps required for remediation Job Requirements What You Will Bring: • Enrolled in a post-secondary degree program such as Cyber Security, Computer Science and/or working towards certifications (CISSP, Security+, CISM, etc) considered an asset • Excellent communication and presentation skills; demonstrate an ability to effectively communicate and present results that articulate key themes and messages • Ability to allocate one's time effectively, work under pressure and manage deadlines; ability to handle multiple demands, competing priorities; willing to learn and adapt to changes in a dynamic environment; organized; detailed orientated and a self starter • Proficient knowledge with Windows Operating Systems, Anti-Virus and email protection software, IT security testing tools, Active Director and Azure AD, Cloud based IT service such as Office 365, OSI model • Excellent communication, oral and written; able to develop and sustain cooperative working relationships; able to be flexible and work with all types of personalities; able to exercise confidentiality and places a priority on client services • Embrace and pro-actively support QuadReal's values and its culture of environmental sustainability and corporate and social responsibility. • Previous experience in an IT related environment, Service/Help Desk, conducting research into IT security issues and products. Citizenship Requirement N/A APPLICATION INFORMATION Application Procedure Through Employer Website Special Application Instructions Please click the "I intend to apply to this position" button on SCOPE and also submit your application via the employer's website. Application Link: https://quadreal.wd3.myworkdayjobs.com/en-US/QuadReal/job/Cyber-Security--Winter-2026---Toronto--Co-op- Internship----4-Months_R0006078?locations=4da06777a526102216fef970b3159ae6 Applications are accepted on a rolling basis and the posting may be expired at any time by the employer as submissions are received. Students should submit their applications as soon as they are ready.
